name: BL1
site-address: Land at Ottery Moor Lane, Honiton
notes: This site is an allocation in the Local Plan for housing development, SHLAA322, formerly part of an industrial estate. Reserved matters application for a residential development of 150 dwellings with appearance, landscaping, layout and scale to be assessed (pursuant to outline consent 14/0557/MOUT)
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL2
site-address: Land at Ottery Moor Lane, Honiton
notes: This site is an allocation in the Local Plan for housing development, SHLAA 321, formerly part of an industrial estate. Site in 2 parts (see above)
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL3
site-address: Land at Pankhurst Close Trading Estate, Pankhurst Close, Exmouth
notes: This site is an allocation in the Local Plan, SHLAA317, formerly in employment use; planning permission renewed June 2019. Construction of 120 dwellings with associated access, landscaping and infrastructure works [this permission incorporates a larger area than the brownfield land in question; around 50 dwgs are planned for the brownfield land]
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL5
site-address: Land and buildings at Winslade Park, Clyst St Mary
notes: This site is an allocation in the Local Plan for mixed use redevelopment, W344 (application not approved). Hybrid outline application for 150 dwellings including full permission for 67 dwellings (conversion of Winslade House and stables) and 0.7ha of employment land use)
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL6
site-address: Land and buildings at 34 Cranford Avenue, Exmouth
notes: Currently under construction. Demolition of existing dwelling and construction of 12 apartments
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL7
site-address: Land North Of Acland Park, Feniton
notes: Application refused but allowed by appeal in 2014; currently under construction. Redevelopment of site and construction of 32 dwellings
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL8
site-address: Land and Buildings at Former Cuttler Hammer Factory and Tumbling Weir Hotel Car Park, Ottery St Mary
notes: Part of a Floodzone 2; townhouses under construction and building work started on car park and the conversion of the old switchgear factory. Redevelopment of parcels of land making up the overall former Cuttler Hammer factory site and Tumbling Weir hotel car park; comprising conversion of building to 30 apartments, construction of 33 new dwellings and 29 retirement apartments
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL9
site-address: Land and buildings at Salston Manor Hotel, Ottery St Mary
notes: Application withdrawn. Construction of 16 dwellings within the grounds of Salston Manor and erection of two storey and single storey extension to form 3 no new flats - WITHDRAWN
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL10
site-address: Land at Seaton Quay (Former Racal Site), Riverside Way Seaton
notes: Part of a Floodzone 2. Erection of 90 apartments, new access, public quayside and flood protection (renewal of planning permission 08/2627/MOUT)
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL12
site-address: Land At Frys Lane, Sidford
notes: Outline application has now expired; reserved matters app withdrawn. Appeal allowed on outline application for construction of 12 dwellings (now expired); reserved matters application withdrawn Apr 2018
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL13
site-address: Land at Victoria Hotel, The Esplanade, Sidmouth
notes: Sleeping - material start made. Erection of two buildings comprising a total of 14 apartments - part of foundations formed
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL15
site-address: Fosse Way Court, Seaton
notes: Part of a Floodzone 2. Refurbishment and extension of existing apartment blocks (inc additional levels) and construction of new link apartment block to provide an additional 30 apartments - EXPIRED
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL16
site-address: Land at the Boatyard, The Harbour, Axmouth, Seaton
notes: Part of a Floodzone 2. Demolition of existing building and erection of 7 residential units and 2 commercial units
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL17
site-address: Land to the rear of The London Inn, Gold Street, Ottery St Mary
notes: Part of a Floodzone 2; building work has begun but only on 7 apartments rather than 13. Construction of 13 apartments to include provision of bicycle and bin storage facilities
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL18
site-address: Central Place, High Street, Honiton
notes: Planning permission renewed August 2018. Demolition of garages erection of 5 dwellings and conversion of existing building to form 1 dwelling
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL20
site-address: Land and buildings at 6 Portland Avenue, Exmouth
notes: Sleeping - material start made. Alterations and extensions to create 9no apartments to include car and cycle parking and associated external works + Alterations and extensions to create 1no additional apartment; work constituting commencement 2016
ownership-status: not owned by a public authority

name: BL21
site-address: Land at 9B Camperdown Terrace, Exmouth
notes: Part of a Floodzone 2; work constituting start on site 2015. Renewal of permission 07/0856/MFUL proposing the construction of 12 flats

name: BL24
site-address: Land at Webster Garage Site, Axminster
notes: Site identified as offering scope for housing development and referred to as such in the East Devon Local Plan, site E173; currently in use a car park with permission granted in Dec 2022

name: BL25
site-address: Lympstone Nurseries, Church Road, Lympstone

name: BL28
site-address: 1 Sarlsdown Road, Exmouth

name: BL31
